result.execSummary:
The defendant Avelardo Manuel VAZQUEZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess cocaine with intent to deliver (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law, to commence immediately.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to delete the penalty enhancer on count 3.   Motion granted.   
Count 1 - Possess cocaine with Intent to Deliver - No contest plea.   
Count 3 - Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 4, and 5.  Motion granted.   
Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.   Sentencing hearing is set for 05-18-17 at 1:30 p.m.   Report to be filed by 05-05-17.   
Court orders defendant submit to DNA sample.

Preliminary hearing held.  Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-12-16 at 3:30 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-26-16 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Authorization to Appear. 
Cover Letter.
Request and Response Re: Copies for Kirk O'bear
RE:  Possess cocaine with intent to deliver, on 01-19-16.
Affidavit of Investigator Andrew Beck, Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department.
At 11:20 a.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess cocaine with intent to deliver.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-08-16 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with David Komorosky or any known drug dealers or users, he is not to possess any controlled substances unless he has a valid prescription or a prescription for a family member and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs. Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  812 Waldo Blvd., Manitowoc, WI, occupied by Avelardo Vazquez.
